citations.title: All-Electric Ford E-Transit Leads the Charge
citations.summary: Ford's E-Transit underwent rigorous testing in its Environmental Test Chamber, simulating extreme temperatures from the Sahara to Siberia to optimize its all-electric powertrain and cabin efficiency. The vehicle features a 68-kWh lithium-ion battery pack with liquid-cooling technology for enhanced performance in harsh conditions, and it is housed beneath the load floor with side-impact protection. Additionally, the E-Transit includes a Scheduled Pre-Conditioning feature that allows drivers to preheat or cool the cabin while the vehicle is charging, preserving battery charge for driving.

citations.title: FORD ACCELERATES ELECTRIFICATION PROMISE ...
citations.summary: Ford plans to install 1,000 charging points at its facilities over the next three years and is a founding member of the IONITY consortium, which aims to establish 400 fast-charging stations in Europe by year-end, featuring a capacity of 350 kW. This infrastructure will significantly reduce charging times for electric vehicles; for instance, the Mustang Mach-E can gain up to 57 miles of range in just 10 minutes at an IONITY station and can charge from 10% to 80% in approximately 38 minutes on a DC fast charger. Additionally, the Ford Connected Wallbox can provide up to five times the charging power of a standard domestic socket for home use.

citations.title: FORD REVEALS ELECTRIFIED VEHICLE LINE-UP THAT ...
citations.summary: Ford is a founding member of the IONITY consortium, which plans to establish 400 fast-charging stations across Europe by 2020, featuring a charging capacity of 350 kW to significantly reduce charging times for all-electric vehicles. The company is collaborating with six major energy suppliers to offer comprehensive charging solutions, including home wall box installations and green energy tariffs, aimed at enhancing the convenience and affordability of charging for plug-in hybrid customers.

citations.title: All-New Ford Mondeo Delivers Widest Ever Range of ...
citations.summary: The all-new Ford Mondeo features an Active Thermal Management System that optimizes warm-up times by selectively cooling components, alongside a variable oil pump that minimizes parasitic losses through on-demand oil pressure adjustments. The 150PS and 180PS 2.0 TDCi variants can be paired with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed PowerShift automatic transmission, achieving ECOnetic specifications of 107g/km CO2 emissions and 68.9mpg fuel efficiency.

citations.title: Ford Reveals New Electrified Vehicle Line-Up at 'Go ...
citations.summary: Ford's upcoming all-electric vehicles will feature advanced connectivity for over-the-air updates and are in the process of establishing comprehensive charging solutions for customers. As a founding member of the IONITY consortium, Ford plans to construct 400 fast-charging stations across Europe by 2020, each with a charging capacity of 350 kW, significantly reducing charging times compared to current systems.

citations.title: Ford Engineers Discover Best Way to Improve Electric ...
citations.summary: Ford engineers, as part of the CEVOLVER project, conducted research on heat management in electric vehicles (EVs) to enhance their design and software updates. The findings emphasize the importance of maintaining interior temperature, particularly in delivery vans, where frequent door openings can lead to rapid heat loss. By optimizing heat exchange from the electric drive, the project aims to reduce energy consumption, thereby improving vehicle range and lowering operational costs.
